info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 21 at 2:23PM EDT until July 21 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT FOR WEST CENTRAL SUFFOLK AND NORTHERN NASSAU COUNTIES... At 223 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Huntington Station to Manhasset, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Huntington Station, Glen Cove, Plainview, Syosset, Mineola, Huntington, Westbury, Great Neck, Oyster Bay, Bayside, Hicksville, Melville, Port Washington, Woodbury and Manhasset. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
